page.title: 16Fox Farm & the Swell Farms
page.content: Fox Farm is completely a cereal farm with a six bin drying/storage system. The bins are built in a semicircle around a central pit where the corn is tipped. 50 hectares were let in 1985 for the growing of oil-seed rape, a break crop from continuous corn. The Heythrop Hunt Point-to-Point races were held on this farm for 30 years. The course is now ploughed-up. Swell Buildings Farm employs a manager and 2 workers. Barley, wheat and oats are grown. 8 hectares of grass made 3000 hay bales in 1985. Summer calves and winter sheep graze the grasslands. Swell Hill Farm belongs to Rockcliffe Estate. The house and a few small fields are let to a family who have 7 stables, keeping other people's horses as well as some of their own. Breaking young horses is carried out as well as the teaching of horse riding.
